questions.question: Which tab in MS Word gives you access to the 'Backstage View' for options like Save, Print, and Open?
questions.explanation: The File tab opens the Backstage View, where you manage the file itself rather than its content.

questions.question: In the Home Tab, which group contains the commands for Cut, Copy, and Paste?
questions.explanation: The Clipboard group typically located on the far left of the Home tab houses Cut, Copy, Paste, and Format Painter.

questions.question: What is the keyboard shortcut to 'Select All' content in a document?
questions.explanation: Ctrl + A is the universal shortcut to select all text and objects in the current document.

questions.question: Which AI-powered tool mentioned in the session is a 'Visual Collaboration Hub' used for project management?
questions.explanation: Trello is a visual tool that organizes your projects into boards, lists, and cards.

questions.question: What happens when you use the 'Justify' alignment on a paragraph?
options: Text aligns only to the left
Text aligns only to the right
Text is distributed evenly between the left and right margins
questions.explanation: Justify alignment adds space between words so the edges of the text are flush with both margins.

questions.question: Which tool in the Clipboard group allows you to copy formatting from one piece of text and apply it to another?
questions.explanation: Format Painter copies the visual look (font, size, color) of text so you can 'paint' it onto other text.

questions.question: If you want to make your text look thicker and darker to emphasize it, which formatting option should you choose?
questions.explanation: The Bold (B) option thickens the text strokes to make them stand out.

questions.question: Where would you find the 'Find and Replace' commands in the Home Tab?
questions.explanation: The Editing group, usually at the far right of the Home tab, contains Find, Replace, and Select.

questions.question: Which feature allows you to organize a list of items using symbols like dots or checks?
questions.explanation: Bullets are symbols used to mark items in an unordered list.

questions.question: What is the standard file extension for a modern Microsoft Word document?
questions.explanation: .docx is the default file format for Word documents created in versions 2007 and later.

questions.question: In the Font group, what does the command 'Change Case' do?
options: Changes text from uppercase to lowercase (and vice versa)
questions.explanation: Change Case allows you to switch text between Sentence case, lowercase, UPPERCASE, Capitalize Each Word, etc.

questions.question: What is the difference between 'Save' and 'Save As'?
options: Save updates the current file; Save As creates a new copy with a different name or location
questions.explanation: Save As is used when you want to save a copy of the document under a new name or file type, leaving the original unchanged.

questions.question: Which Paragraph group command moves the entire paragraph further away from the margin?
questions.explanation: Increase Indent moves the paragraph to the right, increasing the distance from the left margin.

questions.question: Styles in MS Word are primarily used to:
options: Apply a consistent set of formatting (font, size, color) quickly
questions.explanation: Styles allow you to apply a pre-defined set of formatting rules instantly, ensuring consistency across the document.

questions.question: Trello uses which organizational system consisting of columns and cards?
questions.explanation: Trello is based on the Kanban board system, which visualizes work as cards moving through different stages (columns).

questions.question: Which shortcut key is used to 'Cut' selected text?
questions.explanation: Ctrl + X cuts the selected item to the clipboard (think of the X as scissors).

questions.question: In the Font group, 'Subscript' makes text appear:
questions.explanation: Subscript (e.g., Hâ‚‚O) lowers the text slightly below the baseline and makes it smaller.

questions.question: Which visual element at the top of the Word window contains tabs like File, Home, and Insert?
questions.explanation: The Ribbon is the strip of buttons and icons located above the work area in Office applications.

questions.question: Which command would you use to change the background color behind specific text or paragraphs?
questions.explanation: The Shading tool (paint bucket) fills the background behind the selected text or paragraph with color.

questions.question: To center your title on the page, which keyboard shortcut should you use?
questions.explanation: Ctrl + E is the shortcut for Center Alignment.
